title: Error bootstrapping on CentOS

labels.name: T-bootstrap
labels.description: Relevant to the bootstrap subteam: Rust's build system (x.py and src/bootstrap)

body:
It looks like the bootstrapper does not use `cmake3` on CentOS (i.e., CMake 3.x) but instead `cmake` (i.e., version 2.x). This results in the error `CMake 3.4.3 or higher is required.  You are running version 2.8.12.2`. The fix would seem to be obvious: check for `cmake3` before falling back to `cmake`.
